babble.net

Class Router<R extends Request,P extends Response>

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.Router<R,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, ThreadFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpRouter, JSONRPCRouter

    public abstract class Router<R extends Request,P extends Response>
extends Object
implements Runnable, ThreadFactory
    A router manages asynchronous request-response processing. A router does not perform network i/o.
    A router's basic duties are
    • find a matching route for a given request
    • execute the route
    • inform a server with a response when route has finished execution
    This abstract facility implements the mechanics to execute a route and inform a server when response becomes available. The specifics of matching a route to a request is left unspecified for concrete protocol implementation.
    Each route executes in a separate request processing thread supplied by this router. So if a request performs network i/o, the router thread is not blocked.
    Though response to a request is asynchronous, a router does not block on any network channel waiting for the response. Instead it waits on a a promise that is fulfilled when a response becomes available.
    Once the request is complete, the router informs the owning server. The server is responsible for sending the response back to originating client. Thus a router never performs network i/o.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs continually until interrupted to wait for completed responses of the request it has spawned. Once a response is ready, this router informs the server.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • processRequest

        protected void processRequest(R request)
        Processes a request.
        Matches the request to one of the route and executes the route in a separate thread.
        If the request does not match any route, informs the server with an error response instead of throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        request - a request to be processed. never null

      • newThread

        public Thread newThread(Runnable r)
        Crates a daemon thread to process a request
        Specified by:
        newThread in interface ThreadFactory

        Affirms if this router has any registered route.

      • findMatchingRoute

        public abstract Route<R,P> findMatchingRoute(R request)
                                      throws RoutingException
        Matches the given request to one of the registered route.
        Parameters:
        request - a request to be matched with a route
        Returns:
        the matched route.
        Throws:
        RoutingException - if no route matches
